Package javelin.model.unit.skill

Class Skill

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.skill.Skill
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Acrobatics, Bluff, Concentration, Diplomacy, DisableDevice, Disguise, Heal, Knowledge, Perception, SenseMotive, Spellcraft, Stealth, Survival, UseMagicDevice
    public class Skill
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a particular Monster skill, each offering a different gameplay advantage (not necessarily combat-oriented). Monsters often come with a few ranks in a set of skill by default but they can be upgraded like most other game statistics. Progression is traditionally tied to a character class or monster type, with bonuses for high Inteligence - but since Javelin is classless, they are instead trained or untrained, with trained skills always being maximized whenever a new class level is added.
    See Also:
    Monster.ranks, Monster.trained, Skill.SkillUpgrade, Serialized Form

      Guideline DC values, from the SRD.
      class  Skill.SkillUpgrade
      Makes a skill trained, up to 3+int bonus trained skill per unit.
